publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2917# Elaine Smith: In-House Provision of Public Services—That the Parliament congratulates North Glasgow University Hospitals NHS Trust on its decision to transfer porters and domestic staff at Stobhill Hospital, previously outsourced, back into the employment of the NHS trust on 1 May 2002; further congratulates UNISON on its "Positively Public" campaign, which includes support for the principle of having public services of the highest quality provided by an in-house team, and believes that the in-house model of public service provision should be extended right across Scotland.
S1M-2917# In-House Provision of Public Services (lodged on 19 March 2002) Mr John McAllion*

S1M-2917# Elaine Smith: In-House Provision of Public Services—That the Parliament congratulates North Glasgow University Hospitals NHS Trust on its decision to transfer porters and domestic staff at Stobhill Hospital, previously outsourced, back into the employment of the NHS trust on 1 May 2002; further congratulates UNISON on its "Positively Public" campaign, which includes support for the principle of having public services of the highest quality provided by an in-house team, and believes that the in-house model of public service provision should be extended right across Scotland. Supported by: Mr John McAllion
S1M-2917# In-House Provision of Public Services (lodged on 19 March 2002) Donald Gorrie*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S1M-2917# In-House Provision of Public Services (lodged on 19 March 2002) Brian Adam*
S1M-2917# In-House Provision of Public Services (lodged on 19 March 2002) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2917# In-House Provision of Public Services (lodged on 19 March 2002) Pauline McNeill*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-2917# In-House Provision of Public Services (lodged on 19 March 2002) Bill Butler*
S1M-2917# In-House Provision of Public Services (lodged on 19 March 2002) Mr Jamie Stone*
S1M-2917# In-House Provision of Public Services (lodged on 19 March 2002) Janis Hughes*
